answers.answer: My daughter came at a little over 35 weeks.  Tiny but healthy. She was able to come home w us.didn't know they could stop stuff after water broke but u have a great chance since ur over 30 weeks.  Good luck.

I've never had a preemie, but my nephews (twins) we're born at 30 weeks and did great! They needed a little help with breathing and eating a first, they were in the hospital for 6wks, came home and did wonderful. They are almost 2 now with no problems at all :)

My daughter was born at 32 wks she has some breathing problems but she stayed in the nicu for a month it took her a long time to gain weight and eat from the bottle, i had to stay for almost two weeks just bc i had preeclampsia and they were monitoring me. She just turned 2 a couple days ago and she just as bad and just as terrible but i love her even more each day tht passes

My first born came at 34 weeks weighed 4lb 11 so tiny he was in special care 12 days you wouldn't think it now he's a strong boy and very clever he's nearly 5 :) I'm nearly 33 weeks with second boy so very nervous I have a scan tomorrow to see how things are x
My son was born at 34 weeks had to stay in nicu for about 2 1/2 weeks he had someone breathing issue he was born 5 lb 4 not he is almost 10lbs

question: Hi I'm 32wks and so nervous because idk what to expect. My waterbroke this morning And they admitted me into hospital and trying to stop baby from being born. Guess I'm here on bed rest for next month. Any advice from experience moms
title: premature labor/babies
